sub_title: Consultant Capacity Development, Evaluations, Renewable Energy and TVET at Kamphuis Development Consultancy
summary:
40 year’s experience in education and development co-operation as teacher/trainer, chief technical advisor, programme director, and short-term consultant. Short-term assignments in Africa, Asia, Central/Eastern Europe, and the Caribbean. Now Netherlands-based independent senior consultant for Kamphuis Development Consultancy; worked with ETC Foundation as associate consultant, as well as other partners in evaluations, capacity development, renewable energy and TVET. Involved in comprehensive evaluations of the Netherlands’ foreign aid policy as external head consultant for the Policy and Operations Evaluation Department of the Netherlands’ Ministry of Foreign Affairs (IOB), the Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) and several (I)NGOs. Until April 2010 programme manager of ETC’s Technical Training Programme with portfolio of 30 projects per year. Up to 2002 team leader for technical assistance on socio-economic development issues in privatising Srilankan plantation sector.
Until September 1995 director for country programmes of SNV/Netherlands Development Organisation in Guinea-Bissau and Nepal. Responsible for programmes on rural & urban poverty alleviation, political decentralisation, and humanitarian issues. In both countries principal liaison officer for Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs for Dutch funded programmes.

Specialties: Capacity development,programme/project formulation/ management,monitoring&evaluation ,TVET. 

Countries: Angola, Barbados, Benin, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Cape Verde, Cambodia, Cameroon, China, Democratic Republic of Congo, Former GDR, Guinea-Bissau, Hungary, India, Indonesia, Jamaica, Kazakhstan, Kenya, Kyrgyzstan, Laos, Liberia, Malaysia, Mali, Mozambique, Nepal, Niger, Pakistan, Philippines, Russia, Senegal, South Africa, Sri Lanka, Surinam, Tanzania, Togo, Trinidad, Uganda, Vietnam, Zambia and Zimbabwe.

profile_positions.description:
Member Supervising Board of The Missing Middle, which is a not-for-profit initiative that supports Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) in developing countries by facilitating transfer of technical, organisational, and other specific knowledge from international experts to firms in developing countries (6,5 months November 2016 - present).
Evaluation / Strategy Review of the Energising Development Partnership Program (EnDev). EnDev (partnership between Netherlands, Norway, Australia, UK, Switzerland, and Sweden, Ireland and the EU as donors) comprises of 36 projects in about 30 countries (2017), mainly regarding improved cooking systems, and off-grid solar technologies, aside mini-grids, grid extension, and biogas with € 312 million as committed funding. Through EnDev 18.2 million people got access to modern energy sources since 2009. (Assignment period: October 2017-May 2018).
Advisor to the MCA-1 funded project regarding a new System for training and certification in Renewable Energy Technologies (RET) for the labour market in Nusa Tenggara Barat Indonesia (3 months in 2015-2018); 
Assessment of development of  RET teaching in 12 medium technical schools during 2-years period 2016-2018 (2 months 2016-2018)
Joint study on Unconditional Basic Income (UBI) for advising/moderating discussions on UBI on request of those committed to and interested in the issue (4 months 2015-2016).
10 Study reviews on Dutch supported Civil Society Development (CSD) projects in Indonesia and Uganda for the Synthesis study MFS II evaluations commissioned by the Policy and Implementation Evaluations Department (IOB) of the Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs (1 month 2016).

Netherlands Government funded evaluation & monitoring environmental and educational programmes; Study on organisational assessment for Netherlands' NGO's; Team leader of an 'équipe' of SNV Burkina Faso advisors; coaching of advisors' professional performance geared to local commercial activities; Multi country (Angola, Burundi, Democratic Republic of Congo, Kenya, Uganda, Southy Africa, Zimbabwe) evaluation for the Jesuit Refugee Service of its emergency assistance in Africa funded by CORDAID.

profile_positions.description: EU, GIZ and Netherlands' Government funded projects on energy planning, rural electrification, biofuels, pico PV, and strengthening local energy provision in Francophone Western Africa (Mali, Burkina Faso, Niger, Senegal), Eastern Africa (Tanzania), and South East Asia (Vietnam, Indonesia, Philippines, Cambodia, Laos). Activation of energy supply chains and supply chains on energy efficient devises for SME, including economic feasibility assessment of supply chain activation (Result Based Funding and Cost benefit analysis).

profile_positions.description: ETC Foundation team leader curriculum development/ teachers training for 11 medium technical schools in renewable energy technologoies under CASINDO programme (3 months in 2009 – 2011) in Indonesia in the provinces of North Sumatra, Central Java, West Nusa, Papua, and Yogyakarta for RVO (former NL Agency) on behalf of Netherland Ministry of Foreign Affairs; Cooperation with Technical Education Development Centre (TEDC), Bandung;  Manager ETC's Technical Training Programme (TTP) until April 2010. TTP comprised of 30 prjects on yearly basis in Africa (Sub Saharan countries) and South East Asia (Indonesia, Cambodia, Laos, India) covering broad spectrum of technologies (a/o renewable energy, drinking water, and construction). About 40% of the projects were energy-related. Emphasis on curriculum development, teacher training, embedding curricula in local structures.
